title: Almost everything that has to be changed for fix the game
body:
Nerf creep damage

Nerf electrocute, Press the atack, Conqueror (The AD increase), and Grasp

Buff Tower damage, make it choose the max damage between a % of your max hp or a base damage

Buff tower hp and resistances 

Rework Fiddlesticks and change Taric and Tryndamere R 

Nerf the gold income to supports 

Nerf letality, make One shot a thing u are able to do when u are fed, not when you are 0-0. You can do this increasing Armor per lvl and increasing the Letality items cost

Nerf rift herald: Make it more difficult to made (Especially alone)

Delete the scuttle crab changes 

Increase Baron damage, reduce the superminions strength

Delete the Elemental drakes OR make vissible in champion select which ones are gonna appear so you can pick and make a strat knowing it. RNG Ruins the game

Nerf overall damage. Just do it, its not normal to see everyone one shotting each other


**What will this change? Games will be longer, so you will have a chance to stop snowball. This is basically the main problem that game has right now. Doing this crit ADCs will come back to the game and things like "Kaisa-Braum mid/jgl" will stop since you will not be able to win the game at minute 15 because towers are wet paper that heal you
**


**ALSO
**

Fix the client, it works REALLY BAD

Punish the players who deserve to <-------- Quite important

And finally, LISTEN THE FEEDBACK and make changes thinking in something more than the Casual player and the LCS viewers

This post is a bit biased with sarcasm on the bit. People actually upvoted this post which is sad.

- Taric R doesn't need to be changed. It's baitable and has a clear weakness. You fix the jungle - you fix the Taric nuisance you see.
- Buffing tower defensive options shouldn't mean buffing tower damage with the nerf of damage creep. This will cause towers to be too strong. Don't buff towers offensively.
- Lethality doesn't need a nerf but a change. Assassins in general struggle in high elo. What is needed is a change to their design philosophy. I say adding a %missing health mechanic for them to burst squishies or low-health tanks/targets as this will make them more team-fight friendly and playable WITH mages.
- Baron isn't meant to deal damage and shred. It's meant to be contested. Thus, I say buff its damage slightly so it is very difficult in the ideal mid-game (20 minutes) but its damage drastically decreases at 4+ people
- Elemental drakes do not need a removal. Infernal drake simply needs a rework.
- Grasp doesn't need a nerf. It's actually one of the most underperforming runes.
- Press the Attack does not need a nerf. It is the snowball and item viability you are seeing with non-crit builds.
- Conqueror does not need its AD increased nerfed. Its issue is its true damage, viability for losing lanes/champions, abuse cases, and its time mechanic.

Assassins weren't able to 100-0 on one item before and they were viable until their targets began to 3 shots them instead, so it became a "I need to kill x in enough time he can't react or he will kill me instead". Even infamous 100-0 in 0,00 old Rengar didn't do that at level 6 out of the blue. The only assassin that had serious kill pressure in lane was LeBlanc , all others COULD kill but they weren't guaranteed to do it. The most skill expression assa had was the moment to enter in a fight. Go in too early, you get focused on and die, go too late and your team lost the teamfight 4 vs 5.. Now it's "go in whatever and take them out before they can focus you or you get 2 shotted yourself".

They could actually.
In terms of itemazation, it was way better back then. We didn't need to relie on {{item:3147}} to one shot someone.
We had Brutalizer that gave us 10% flatArmorPen (not this thing lethality that scales with lvl) and the old 2300gold Last Whisper. 
The combination of the old {{item:3035}} and the old {{item:3142}} was extremly powerfull, because back in the days, {{item:3142}} gave 20% ArmorPen + 10%CDR + 60AD (I think) + 15% Critical Chance, and the active provided not only movement speed, but also attack speed.
Also, we had {{item:3071}} that had a way better build path and offered more AD and less HP, and the passive of ArmorPen would stack up to 36% (currently only stacks up to 24%).

But by the time you got those items your enemy mage could get a seeker + mana component. A kill itemless was possible but it required playing the fight better than the opponent and weaving autos into a full combo. In that scenario it's completely fair to be able to kill. Now a full optimally executed combo from almost any assassins overkills , so he can fuck up and still kill. If it wasn't this way however it would be impossible for them to do their job in the current state of the game once they leave lane.

But back in the days {{item:3191}} alone wouldn't negate as hard the damage of the assassins, because of how ArmorPen used to work vs the Lethality stat we have nowdays. Also, mages had to actually worry  about mana management. Nowdays, you can tell me as much as you want that people still need to, but it's far more easier for them to shove 3 waves with their wave clear avantage and back.
Also, mages back in the days had only had the active of {{item:3157}} when they had the full item, wich nowdays you can buy it for 600 gold ({{item:2419}} ), and even tough it's a one time use, it will save you from one death and make the assassin waste his cooldowns on you wich will lead him to have to play safer because he will vulnerable and probably won't roam either without his ultimate.
